description:
Bayesian Inference of Phylogeny

MrBayes is a program for Bayesian inference and model choice across a wide range of phylogenetic and evolutionary models. MrBayes uses Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) methods to estimate the posterior distribution of model parameters.
News:
- Added lognormal and flat ordered dirichelet distributions as alternatives to the gamma prior on site variation across sites.
- Added new, optional moves for the fossilized birth-death model.
- Added new, optional parsimony-guided moves for non-clock trees.
- Support for Beagle 3 added.
- Added support for FMA and AVX instructions in built-in likelihood calculators for 4by4 nucleotide models.
- Added basic command line option support on Unix systems (-h,-i,-v)
- Various minor bug fixes.

Note March 20: Windows binaries are provisional (without beagle).
